page.title: 05EDGEBOLTON FARM - TWO
page.content: Edgebolton means{'Edge's Land'}because in Saxon times{ton}was a measurement of land. The farmer and his son own{175 acres. The farm has been in their family since 1930,though the house is 140 years old.He grows{wheat, sugar beet {and barley.}He keeps{pigs and cattle.} He has the{Roden}and five ponds on his land.When he took up a hedge he first spent three years finding out what lived in it and the runs used by different species. {Stoats,foxes,field mice,field {voles,swans,voles,badgers,skylarks, {peewits,minks,water voles and yellow {hammers plus most common birds}live on the farm. The natural habitats of the farm can be divided into three main areas,the banks of the{River Roden,} the{hedgerows}and the{water pits.
